thread.title: Blue Jays topple Royals, 7-1, to avoid elimination in ALCS
thread.title_full: Blue Jays topple Royals, 7-1, to avoid elimination in ALCS

author: Associated Press
title: Blue Jays topple Royals, 7-1, to avoid elimination in ALCS
text:
Blue Jays topple Royals, 7-1, to avoid elimination in ALCS Jose Bautista, Edwin Encarnacion Frank Gunn / Associated Press 
Blue Jays right fielder Jose Bautista, left, and designated hitter Edwin Encarnacion celebrate after scoring on a three-run double by Troy Tulowitzki in the sixth inning in Game 5 of the ALCS. 
Blue Jays right fielder Jose Bautista, left, and designated hitter Edwin Encarnacion celebrate after scoring on a three-run double by Troy Tulowitzki in the sixth inning in Game 5 of the ALCS. (Frank Gunn / Associated Press) Associated Press 
Marco Estrada pitched one-hit ball into the eighth inning, giving Toronto's tattered bullpen a rest and leading the Blue Jays over the Kansas City Royals, 7-1, Wednesday in Game 5 of the American League Championship Series. 
Troy Tulowitzki broke open the game with a three-run double off Kelvin Herrera in the sixth, giving him seven RBIs in the series. See the most-read stories in Sports this hour >> Open link 
Edwin Encarnacion had walked with the bases loaded against Edinson Volquez, who seemed flustered by close calls against the Royals. 
Estrada faced the minimum 20 batters before Lorenzo Cain walked with two outs in the sixth. Closer Roberto Osuna was perfect in the ninth. 
Toronto forced the series back to Kansas City, which the Royals lead 3 games to 2. 
Yordano Ventura will start for the defending AL champions on Friday against David Price.
